title: Statistical Analyst/Data Scientist (Machine Learning)
description:
Our Industry: Where we play
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development. Our work ensures that life-saving drugs and medical devices get to market faster. We are a certified “Great Place to Work” with highly engaged employees focused on improving the health outcomes of patients across the globe.

We develop cloud-based enterprise products and services and are a world leader driving the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of the most exciting areas for innovation globally. With annual revenue in 2016 of nearly $500 million, we are publicly traded (MDSO) with over 850 customers and customer retention rates above 99%. The Medidata Clinical Cloud® is the primary technology solution powering clinical trials for 18 of the world's top 25 global pharmaceutical companies and is used by 18 of the top 25 medical device developers—from study design and planning through execution, management and reporting. Our customers include global pharmaceutical companies, biotech, diagnostic and device firms, leading academic medical centers, technical partners and contract research organizations.

By automating over 12,000 clinical trials to date, Medidata has the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. Today, Medidata pioneers innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing a new level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials. That means better treatments reach waiting patients sooner.

We know that diverse teams win. It is our diversity and inclusiveness that fuels innovation and sparks our passion and commitment to patient health. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 1900 employees.

Your Mission:

This position will research and develop statistical models within the data science group at Medidata.

Your Competencies:
Design, develop and validate statistical models for novel medical applications. Areas of team focus include mHealth, genomics, and other projects in support of design, analysis, and meta-analysis of clinical trials.Provide support functions around model-building, including data cleaning and code reviewProductionalize developed methods and code for integration with existing/new productsReport findings to internal teams and clients
Skills/Requirements:
Proficiency in R, Python and/or SAS languagesStrong verbal and written communication; collaborative focusExperience using Git version control

Your Education & Experience:
Ph.D. or Masters in statistics or data science, or in related field with strong foundation in statistical methodology2+ years of experience with statistical analysis in a healthcare related field is desired




Our Culture: Who we are
We know that creativity doesn't happen on-demand. Developing cutting-edge cloud technology takes great minds and talented people working together in a collaborative environment. That is why we are committed to fostering an innovative, agile company culture. We encourage our teams to come together and experiment with new concepts, research new approaches and test out new technologies. We believe that being part of our team will make a difference in the world.

Our Mission: Powering smarter treatments and healthier people.
Our Vision: To be the most innovative cloud company in Life Sciences.
Our Principles: Integrity, Partnership, Inventiveness, Humility, Nimbleness, Tenacity, Inclusiveness, and Caring.
Our Leadership Drivers:
THINK: Inspires purpose, articulates strategy, and simplifies complexityTEAM: Communicates effectively, builds relationships and collaborates with othersDO: Plans ahead, scales for growth, ensures accountabilityLEARN: Self-aware, values difference, strives to learnTEACH: Inspires work, coaches others, builds teams
EEO Statement

US:
Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

description:

title: Analyst, Research
description:
The Turner Story
Turner Broadcasting System, Inc., a Time Warner company, creates and programs branded news; entertainment; animation and young adult; and sports media environments on television and other platforms for consumers around the world. Turner brands and businesses include CNN, HLN, CNN International and CNN.com; TBS, TNT, Turner Classic Movies and truTV; Cartoon Network, Boomerang and Adult Swim; and Turner Sports. http://www.turner.com

See what it’s like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook

What part will you play?
The Analyst will be a part of the Sales Research team within CNN Research.

What will you be doing?
Develops top line and detailed analyses, reporting, and highlights supporting CNN sales and marketing Effectively leverages internal and syndicated data to create analyses Responsibilities comprise responding to requests from sales (RFP/RFI), sponsorship reporting, and supporting work on advertising effectiveness studies Produce user friendly reports highlighting key consumer highlights and performance dashboards that can be shared both internally and externally Play an active role in qualitative and quantitative primary research projects, including helping gather key assets, analyzing the data and creating presentations

What do we need from you?
Minimum of 1 year of digital research/analytics experience at a publisher, media agency or research vendor
Prior experience using comScore, Nielsen @Plan, GFK MRI, Simmons Experian, YouGov, social analytic tools (Shareablee, Facebook Insights, ListenFirst or Nielsen Social), and market research tools (Mintel, eMarketer)
Experience using Adobe Analytics, Adobe reportbuilder/workspace, and Nielsen NMI is a plus
Familiarity with Nielsen TV is a plus Experience supporting ad effectiveness research is a plus
Demonstrated expertise using Microsoft Office including Excel, Word and PowerPoint (experience using Pivot Tables and Macros is a plus)
Ability to manage and balance multiple priorities in a fast-paced, complex business environment and can manage time effectively to consistently meet deadlines
Strong knowledge of digital marketing ecosystem and media business

But wait, there’s more!
Paid time off every year to volunteer
2016 Best Company for Working Mothers
An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career
Part of the Time Warner family of powerhouse brands like HBO, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, TNT, and TBS

Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Ad Product Operations Analyst (New York)
description:
The Role

BuzzFeed is looking for a smart, detail-oriented, analytical, and motivated individual to join our New York team as an Ad Product Operations Analyst. The position will focus on digital ad trafficking and promotion of BuzzFeed’s display advertising products, analyzing data trends to make optimization decisions, and recapping performance to ensure positive campaign results. This position will require daily interaction with other internal teams such as Client Services, Sales, Operations, and our external clients to ensure consistent and smooth delivery of all advertising campaigns.

You Will


Manage execution and fulfillment of BuzzFeed Display advertising according to media plans and client requirements.
Optimize campaigns in DFP Premium while ensuring minimal discrepancies with any 3rd party tracking providers.
Conduct data analysis on audience segments and campaign performance and use findings to optimize campaigns.
Perform thorough QA checks on ad creatives, and work with the Client Services team to resolve any issues or concerns.
Assist with custom tech projects that increase workflow efficiencies and improve ad product performance.
Complete data input for billing operations for all ad delivery.
Actively contribute to the development and prioritization of new features and functionality for a constantly evolving product line.

You Have


Experience working with with third party ad server - DFP Premium preferred.
Highly analytical with strong quantitative skills and a strong working knowledge of Excel.l
Ability to independently manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines.
Basic skills in HTML, familiarity with JS and CSS a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong creative problem-solving skills and an ability to think outside the box and come up with unique solutions to complex problems.
High level of attention to detail and excellent organizational skills. Bachelor’s Degree.

*

To Apply


Please submit your resume and cover letter including why you are interested in the Ad Product Operations role and why you would be a good fit.

About BuzzFeed

BuzzFeed is the leading independent digital media and tech company delivering news and entertainment content to a global audience. We have offices in 19 cities around the world and more than 1600 employees including reporters, video producers, data scientists, engineers, brand strategists, and more. We fuse hard work and fun, through a culture of experimentation, teamwork, equality, and humble confidence. As an employee, you’ll enjoy perks like office events, snacks, career development courses, and no work on your birthday! But most importantly, you’ll work with inspiring colleagues to build tools and create content that helps connect people all over the world.

title: Data Insights Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a highly motivated engineer with a strong technical background to join Bluecore’s Data Insights and Strategy team. Your job will be to build, automate, and maintain various scalable processes for delivering insights distilled from terabytes of behavioral and purchase data across hundreds of retail sites. We’re looking for someone with a solid technical background fluent in SQL and Python, who enjoys and appreciates creative thinking, efficient workflows, and digging into data. You’ll be working closely with the analysts and strategists on the Insights team, as well as Bluecore’s software and data engineering teams.

The Data Insights and Strategy team has two key focuses - First to deliver custom deep dive analysis to Bluecore’s largest enterprise clients, and second (and equally important as the first) to productize and scale the most relevant insights so that they can be delivered to all Bluecore clients. As the most technical member of the Insights team, you will be responsible for developing efficient and robust processes for automating and scaling the team’s data analytics. Bluecore has amazing data, but you’ll need a keen eye and meticulous thought process for detecting bad data, anticipating and handling unusual scenarios, and building with future growth in mind.
Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain scalable automations for analysis using tools such as Airflow and Looker.
Work with analysts to generalize and templetize analysis developed on Jupyter Notebooks with a combination of Pandas, Google BigQuery, and CloudSQL.
Develop efficient methods of delivering insights and visualizations to both clients and internal stakeholders.
Scope and own the automation projects within the Insights team.
Requirements
BS in technical fields such as Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics
2+ years experience in software engineering, data engineering, or other similarly technical role, preferably related to data
Experience with Airflow or other workflow management systems to automate ETL pipelines
Experience with R, Python Pandas or other languages for data analysis is a must
Fluency in SQL and Python a must
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Benefits
Highly competitive compensation package including salary and equity as well as the opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing marketing technology start-ups
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) plan
Monthly fitness stipend for a gym membership or fitness classes
Monthly NYC Metro Card
Generous Parental Leave & flexible vacation policy
At Bluecore we believe in fostering an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences.

Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

title: Data Analyst
description:
CIS is seeking a highly quantitative, driven, process/detail-oriented, and creative Data Analyst who will serve as a member of the Business Development Team. This position will have a day-to-day focus on providing analytical, strategic, and operational support to the SVP of Sales and Business Services and functional leaders across the company. You will work cross-functionally with several business unit owners with the primary objective of enabling data-driven decisions.

The ideal candidate for the Data Analyst role has proven experience with data management, data visualization, data storage, data extraction, sales ops and marketing analytics, statistics, and related fields. The ideal candidate has also successfully conceptualized, built and maintained a data warehouse to collect, store, query, and visualize information using large data sets and APIs within a business, solving for the needs of multiple business units. We anticipate that the needs and issues we face today will be different six months from now, therefore self-guided education, flexibility, and innovation are key to a long-term growth with CIS.

Here’s a Snapshot of your Tasks and Responsibilities
Determine CIS’s current data quality and maturity level.
Identify opportunities to improve data quality, extraction, storage, transformation, and visualization related to all CIS and MS-ISAC products and services.
Establish data policies, standards, organization, and enforcement of data management process.
Conduct customer, market and sales pipeline analysis as requested to better assess sales opportunities for all products and services (SecureSuite Memberships, Partner Paid Monitoring services, CIS Controls, and MS-ISAC memberships.
Partner with the business and product teams to understand their challenges, provide them data driven insights they can act on, and work with them to iterate and improve the solutions they implement.
Develop member and project-specific measurement plans to align mission, business, marketing, and digital objectives with our proposed business development strategies and project plans.
Coordinate with the business unit owners on any needs for analytics access, member-specific data requirements/requests, dependencies, toolsets, or other areas critical to the successful completion of projects and tasks.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Filter and “clean” data and analytics by reviewing spam trends, analytics reports, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems.
Create and/or update requirements, design specifications and technical documentation for reporting solutions and conceptualize, develop and maintain ongoing reports, dashboards, and accompanying documents.
Extrapolate and present meaningful insights, trends, and patterns from complex and large datasets that align with CIS objectives and strategies.
Independently (or collaboratively with the creative team) use data visualization tools to produce requested analysis and reports.
Provide accurate reports to key stakeholders in a timely manner and quickly troubleshooting solutions to known data problems.
Build digital reports for management and cross-functional teams (report formats may include spreadsheets, presentations, dashboards, written documentation, charts, etc.).
Stay informed of industry and technology updates and effectively communicate to the team and clients how those affect data quality, process, tools, web analytics, data visualization, and reporting.
Other tasks and responsibilities as assigned.
What are we looking for in you?
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science or related field*
5-10 years’ analytical experience including report-writing and experience with analyzing data and developing reports or dashboards
Demonstrated experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, etc), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)
Demonstrated experience with web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, HubSpot, Adobe Analytics, Azure, and AWS Services
Demonstrated experience with Apple software, Microsoft Office products (Excel), Google products (Google Sheets and Slides), Salesforce, and HubSpot
Demonstrated experience with one or more high-level scripting languages such as JavaScript, Python, and R
Technical knowledge of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques using tools like Google BigQuery
Strong interpersonal skills with examples of active listing, critical thinking, conflict resolution, relationship management, and strong communication and organizational skills
Exceptional attention-to-detail and self-managed processes for ensuring data accuracy through collection, organization, analysis, and dissemination
Demonstrated problem solving ability with experience providing business insights and recommendations from data to executive audiences
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Excellent customer service skills
Must be able to present samples of past work
Must be authorized to work in the United States

Additional years of relevant experience or a combination of an Associate’s degree and relevant experience may be substituted for the Bachelor’s degree.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing sales and marketing analytics as well as data warehouses for digital, marketing or enterprise-level organizations
Core Competencies
Drive innovation by providing active coaching to support colleagues and/or team members in reframing problems and adapting approaches to solve problems either independently or within work team.
Manage projects simultaneously, producing work related to multiple projects & processes.
Communicate effectively with strong verbal communication & presentation skills; effectively adjusting written and verbal communication styles to different audiences; listen for understanding.
Manage change and promote adaptability, encouraging colleagues and team members to align work within a dynamic work environment.
Take responsibility by creating a culture of accountability through communicating clear goals (associated with project management), objectives, time frames, and expected levels of effort; provide recognition and feedback; actively address any issues in a timely manner.
The CIS Offer
A culture that is engaging, fun and energetic
An organization that supports Work/Life balance
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision and life insurance
401K plan with company match
Bonding and military leave
Paid time off upon date of hire
Tuition and certification reimbursement
Relocation assistance
On-site wellness programs
Community involvement opportunities
An environment that promotes growth and professional development including our award-winning training opportunities

title: Junior Analyst
description:
Overview
Focal Point Data Risk is a new type of risk management firm, one that delivers a unified approach to addressing data risk through a unique combination of service offerings. Focal Point has brought together industry-leading expertise in enterprise risk management, cyber security, identity governance and access management, data privacy and analytics, internal audit, and hands-on training services, giving companies everything, they need to plan and develop effective risk and security programs. By integrating these services, we provide our clients with the flexible support they need to protect and leverage data across any part of their organization. Simply put, Focal Point is the next generation of risk management.

The Enterprise Risk Consulting (ERC) Junior Analyst has a dual role working under the direct supervision of ERC senior and management, providing junior analyst-level Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) project engagement support and ERC administrative support.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Creates client pitch and project-based presentations in coordination with ERC team members. Supports project timelines and deliverables through various project management activities in collaboration with or as directed by ERC leadership or senior team members. Facilitates project data requests and follow-ups, data aggregation and organization and performs summary analysis of key information to support project deliverables. Provides confidential operational and administrative support to senior ERC leadership, management and designated team members. Leads overall internal ERC team planning and logistics including drafting department standard processes and procedures, team calendar and data room, and processing ERC and project-related expenses and invoices.Communicates and follows-up with clients, prospects, vendors and other organizations as needed or directed. Supports the creation of internal training or external business development materials to various stakeholders to drive awareness and understanding of ERC capabilities and service offerings.Maintains ERC’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system based on input from management. Supports ERC leadership and management on special projects or other duties, as needed.Assists with onboarding tasks for ERC team members and independent contractors.Develops and demonstrates a solid working knowledge of the Company’s structure, service lines, key personnel, policies and procedures.
Qualifications
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Risk Management, Insurance, Mathematics, Business Administration or related educational background, or professional equivalent working experience.Experience working in fast paced consulting environments; Big 4 (or similar) internship and/or work experience is a plus.
Technical Requirements
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio and Access); Advanced Microsoft Outlook skillset;Working knowledge or ability to quickly learn Salesforce or other CRM tools; andAbility to develop and demonstrate solid knowledge of company-wide tools, processes, and databases.
Travel Required: Up to 50% (domestic and international)

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

title: Analyst
description:
Career Opportunity


Role Title


Analyst

Purpose of role


Responsible for the fundamental analysis of Foresters financials’ financial and competitive positioning and provides due diligence on industry trends, company management and strategies.

Job Description


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct company research including financial analysis, due diligence on industry trends, company management and strategies.
Analyze Foresters Financials’ financial and competitive positioning.
Maintain research on current holdings and researching potential investments.
Synthesize and assess financial, industry data.
Conduct primary research through industry sources.
Communicate investment ideas through discussions with the portfolio manager and team members.
Discuss and monitor market developments and trends of relevant current events with portfolio manager and team members to determine the best portfolio strategies.
Utilize various quantitative portfolio management tools to optimize portfolios and initiate trades.


EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
College degree

EXPERIENCE AND BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS:
At least 5 years’ experience in financial services industry researching and analyzing markets and portfolio risk
Strong analytical ability with solid quantitative skills
Experience with outside databases such as Lipper, Morningstar and Informa is a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office with accurate data entry skills
Exceptional written and oral communication skills as well as interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a deadline driven environment required
Work both in a team environment as well as independently
WORK ENVIRONMENT: (Office, production, warehouse, etc.)
Office

Only those candidates who will be selected for further consideration will be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team. Foresters Financial is committed to supporting diversity and accessibility. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Research and Acceleration Analyst
description:
With the breathtaking pace at which data is growing, and with new types of data coming online and new hypotheses becoming measurable, we continue to face the inspiring and exciting challenge to reveal value in the world’s data. We are seeking intellectually curious and creative analysts who are deeply passionate about data exploration, augmentation, and analysis to join our team.
In this role, you will partner with our close-knit team of quantitative researchers, data scientists, engineers, and data sourcing colleagues to translate data into actionable insights and to accelerate our vibrant research pipeline. Key responsibilities include:
Identifying, ingesting, and enriching a wide range of structured and unstructured big data into datasets for analysis;
Operating and extending the data infrastructure platform to deliver production-grade data curation and analysis services;
Thinking and acting as data integrity managers - amplifying data quality and completeness with a process-driven approach and measurement dashboards;
Owning end-to-end data workflows and developing deep domain expertise on the underlying actors and behaviors manifested through data;
Communicating data-driven analysis and insights in the form of “data studies” that enable our investment management research process.
Requirements Include:
A strong academic track record with university coursework or related data analysis experience.
Applied data analysis experience, especially using popular scripting languages (particularly Python) and/or data analysis tools and languages (PyData, R, Julia, Matlab, Tableau).
Experience with SQL and relational databases.
Deep intellectual curiosity and passion for data.
Excellent problem solving, communication, and analytical skills.
Eagerness to work in an evolving and fast-paced environment.
While financial industry experience is a plus, we are open-minded in our search for critical thinkers who are passionate about technology and data.

title: Business/Reporting Analyst, Office of Data Management
company: New York City Department of Education .
description:
Position Summary: The New York City school system is the largest in the country, composed of approximately 1.1 million students and 75,000+ teachers in over 1,800 schools. The Office of Data Management (ODM) is part of the Office of Policy and Evaluation (OPE), within the Division of Teaching and Learning (DT&L). OPE is the primary source of data analysis, research, and academic policy for the DOE. ODM is the business intelligence unit of the DOE. Team members process assessment data, support a growing SQL repository of DOE data systems, build data tools that support instruction, fulfill data requests from across Central offices, serve as data consultants and thought partners, project-manage the reporting of data to the state’s longitudinal data system, and produce documentation to support data users throughout the organization.

With guidance from ODM leadership, the Business/Reporting Analyst plays a critical role in driving excellence in academic data reporting, analytics, and knowledge management. The Analyst analyzes reporting requirements in relation to DOE policies and data assets; fulfills internal data requests; conducts systems analysis/programming (operational application systems and relational databases); documents data systems and processes; creates resources to support the continuous improvement of DOE programs and data analytics; and works with ODM colleagues, DOE program offices and technical partners to develop and improve business rules for data reporting. Additionally, the Analyst may provide guidance to the junior Technical Writer/Analyst around documentation and quality assurance processes, depending on business needs. Performs related work.

Reports to: Team Lead, Office of Data Management

Direct Reports: N/A

Key Relationships: Senior Director, Office of Data Management; Office of Data Management Directors, Team Leads, Analysts, and Programmers. Works closely with the Office of Policy and Evaluation (OPE), the Division of Instructional and Information Technology (DIIT), subject matter experts throughout the DOE, and NYSED data staff.

Responsibilities

Assist in the planning, development, and administration of academic data collection and reporting systems that fulfill state and federal requirements.
Review and evaluate local, state and federal education policies that impact rules and processes for collecting and reporting data.
Liaise between program offices and technical partners to develop business rules for transforming and reporting data, including teams from the Division of Teaching and Learning, the Division of English Language Learners and Student Support (DELLSS), and the Division of Specialized Instruction and Student Support (DSISS).
Provide technical assistance in academic program development and evaluation by documenting stakeholders, business rules, requirements, processes, and outcomes.
Develop and communicate policy and program insights based on rigorous analysis of reported data.
Develop project analyses and programming routines using structured query language (SQL) and analytical tools.
Compile reporting and analytics knowledge management resources that support student learning and achievement and continuous improvement of NYC DOE programs and policies.
Perform analyses to provide validation and quality assurance support.
Support data management activities: communicate objectives and guidelines; provide support; ensure desired outcomes.
Implement work plans and project schedules based on the scope and time frames set by the team leader, external and internal clients, and other stakeholders. Liaise with DIIT as needed.
Design and develop reports that will be used to measure data quality and inform users.
Participate in the solution design to ensure consistency between requirements and specifications.
Identify and escalate issues to leadership team as necessary; provide suggestions for resolution.
Quickly assess and resolve complex issues, ranging from data management to customer service.
Provide regular status reports to the team leader and other ODM leadership, as required; represent the data management team by working cross-functionally with ODM colleagues and program offices.


Qualification Requirements:

Minimum

A master’s degree from an accredited college in education, guidance, educational administration and supervision, or a related field; or
A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and one of the following:
(A) one year of full-time satisfactory professional experience in educational program administration, career or occupational program administration; or
(B) one year of full-time satisfactory professional experience as a state certified or licensed teacher; or
A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and five years of full-time satisfactory professional experience in educational program administration, career or occupational program administration; or
A combination of education and/or experience which is equivalent to the requirements in "1," "2," and "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least an approved four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent.

Preferred

Experience in data analytics and reporting.
Experience working with data integrity and improving processes for increased data quality.
Experience gathering business requirements from business owners, program offices, and/or subject matter experts (SMEs).
Experience designing and executing quality assurance tests.
Experience writing technical and user documentation, business requirements documents, and standard operating procedures.
Prior experience working in a fast-paced, complex working environment.
Analytical, process-oriented thinker and problem-solver.
Ability to perform independent research, data collection, and analysis.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong strategic thinking and project management skills, attention to detail, and the ability to proactively identify key issues and risks.
Ability to work independently and adapt quickly to changing priorities
Knowledge of best practices in data governance, analysis and reporting.
Working knowledge of the public sector and/or demonstrated interest in public education.
Excellent interpersonal skills in working with technical and non-technical personnel.
Ability to provide leadership and guidance to junior staff as needed.
Excellent command of SQL; understanding of relational databases.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence Reporting tools.
Experience using project management tools.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications, e.g., Excel, Word, Access, and Visio.
Internal candidates preferred.

Salary: $66,981+

(Internal candidates who are selected for this position and who currently hold comparable or less senior positions within the DOE will not make less than their current salary.)

Please submit a resume an cover letter with your application.

Applications will be accepted through May 22, 2018 until 3:00 p.m.

NOTE: The filling of all positions is subject to budget availability.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

It is the policy of the Department of Education of the City of New York to provide educational and employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, alienage and citizenship status, age, marital status, disability, prior record of arrest or conviction (except as provided by law), sexual orientation, gender (sex), and to maintain an environment free of discriminatory harassment, including sexual harassment, or retaliation as required by civil rights law. Inquiries regarding compliance with this equal opportunity policy may be directed to: Office of Equal Opportunity, 65 Court Street, Room 1102, Brooklyn, New York 11201, or visit the OEO website at http://schools.nyc.gov/OEO

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Reporting to the Lead Manager of the Implementation Management Office, this role will assist in managing multiple strategic programs to support and enhance the value of a listed Company.

The role can be reporting into the Charlotte NC, New York, or the Syracuse office.

This vast program will ultimately oversee and ensure alignment of the IT, General Business Services and Other Business Readiness work streams, in addition to alignment with overall project governance. Additionally, the program has organization-wide purview including planning and monitoring of activities and Key Performance Indicators spanning detailed transition planning and project execution for each business area, baselining and assessment of business activities, processes and technologies.
This position will play a critical role in supporting the implementation of an appropriate cadence and coordination with all critical business partners – ultimately creating the plan for "stand-alone" readiness and ensuring execution of strategic initiatives.

Primary Responsibilities
Assist in the planning and the target state design of the operating model:
o Work closely with business area teams to identify all key functional processes across the firm
o Assist in the direction of consultant relationships
o Identify issues, structure problems and generate actionable recommendations using formal problem solving frameworks and critical thinking
Support weekly status reports, SteerCo reports, Group interactionsParticipate in the creation of presentations to senior management, including Excom, in very clear, structured formatsUnderstand broad project planning requirements; lay out a project plan with direction from appropriate business area stakeholders, as necessaryDevelop and write executive-level memos and research papersManage ambiguity, complex subject matters and concurrent deliverablesSupport multiple work streams and assist in meeting stated goalsDeliver data extracted from the work schedule to proactively manage issues/risks along with the critical pathDraw conclusions based on independent evaluation of data and project schedules for review by the project teamWork seamlessly with team members, leadership committee to achieve outcomes
BA / BS required1-3 years of work experienceStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to facilitate meetings and communicate resultsAbility to develop strong relationships with business partners and team membersThorough data accuracy and integrity without exceptionExperience working with complex project schedules and ability to interpret resultsProven analytical problem solving skillsMaintain highest ethical standards; demonstrate practicality, integrity, promotes diversity and a culture of inclusionBusiness process consulting a strong plus (Six Sigma, Lean, etc.)Change management experience a strong plusSoftware skills; Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Visio (or equivalent mapping process software)Ability to operate independently in an ambiguous and changing environmentDemonstrated ability to collaborate well with management in a complex and matrix environment within an organization, and globally

title: HBO Analyst, Distribution Strategy
description:
OVERALL SUMMARY:

The Distribution Strategy Analyst position is part of HBO's Global Distribution department. The position will support the Manager in preparing industry marketplace and distribution-related reports/analyses for sales, marketing, senior management, as well as other internal stakeholders. Areas of concentration include, but are not limited to, traditional multichannel video trends, digital distribution opportunities, and competitive landscape analyses. The Analyst will craft business narratives using data to inform sales and marketing efforts that best position HBO in the marketplace. Candidate should have strong analytical skills and a passion/interest in the media industry/changing entertainment/TV business. Knowledge/experience with subscription businesses a plus.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify, track, summarize, and analyze industry, technology, and/or economic trends that may impact HBO’s business
Regularly update departmental trackers with subscriber estimates and other industry related insights/metrics
Distill industry information from analyst reports as well as other third party research in a relevant, meaningful way; track performance and analyst estimates across major video distributors
Create summaries, charts and presentations to inform distribution team and senior management about relevant industry topics
Help prepare and analyze HBO cross-platform viewing reports (HBO On Demand, HBO GO, HBO NOW) specific to affiliate partner distributors
Work closely with both Manager and Director to provide support on various ad/hoc analyses, reports and presentations as requested
Monitor marketing tactics (e.g. pricing, packaging) across traditional and digital distributors through third party database and present findings to teams

REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s Degree
Intermediate Excel, Word, PowerPoint skills
2+ years in a media or technology company. Knowledge of a subscription business a plus.
Strong analytical, organizational and communication/presentation skills. Attention to detail a must.
Comfortable with providing presentations to large audiences.
Knowledgeable about the traditional and digital media landscape as it pertains to HBO’s distributors, partners, and competitors.
Familiarity with market research and TV ratings are a plus. Comfortable with large data sets
Creativity in designing visual aids/slides that support related business insights / trends a plus.
Team player with experience in interdepartmental collaboration and communication.

title: Intermediate Investment Analyst
description:
Job Description

OppenheimerFunds is seeking an Analyst on the Global Equity team, specifically for the International Small-Mid Company Fund with $10 billion in assets under management. The team has a leading long-term track record, with average performance in the top decile over a period of ten years, along with low employee turnover. A compelling opportunity for the exceptional candidate, the Analyst will work on a lean team with the Portfolio Manager and two other Analysts, and will be responsible for generating investment ideas in the portfolio with rigorous company-specific, bottom-up fundamental analysis. The Analyst will have to use a robust analytical framework in the context of the team’s investment philosophy, which focuses on high-quality businesses with sustainable competitive advantages that offer a compelling long-term investment opportunity.
Specific Responsibilities:
Work with the Portfolio Manager and other Analyst to analyze current and prospective equity holdings and to generate investment ideasPerform deep fundamental research including company visits, business valuation analysis, building financial models, meeting with company managements, attending industry conferences, among other investment related activitiesPrepare brief written reports on selected investment option highlighting non-obvious insights into long-term opportunities Qualifications

Competencies for Success:
Demonstrated track record of excellence academically and professionallyAdvanced degree with 1 - 3 years of relevant analytical experience in investments, investment banking or consulting post graduate program is idealPassion for long-term investing in global equity markets and a deep fundamental investment approach combined with exceptional analytical skillsAbility and willingness to travelStrong critical thinking skills; able to make good decisions when faced with complex or ambiguous dataRobust intellectual curiosity, inquistiveness, integrity, creativity along with a balance of self confidence and humility
Applicants are invited to submit a relevant investment write-up with their resume

Additional Information


We are a dynamic firm that values teamwork and collaboration, and true to our history, we encourage independent thinking and provide ample opportunities for our people to stand out and make a difference. With offices in New York, Denver, Rochester and Dallas, Seattle, Philadelphia, and London, we work hard to turn our unconventional wisdom into value for investors and pursue excellent results for ourselves and our firm. Learn more about the culture and opportunities at OppenheimerFunds here: https://careers.oppenheimerfunds.com

OppenheimerFunds and its subsidiaries and affiliates provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law in all employment functions including recruitment, evaluation, selection, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, and termination of employment.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Analyst
description:
About Essence

Essence, part of GroupM, is a global data and measurement-driven agency that blends data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, FrieslandCampina, and the Financial Times. The agency is more than 1,100 people strong, manages over $3.2B in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via its global offices throughout North America, EMEA and APAC.

Visit essenceglobal.com ( essenceglobal.com ) for more information and follow us on Twitter at @essenceglobal

About the Role

Essence is seeking an Analyst (data!) to join our team in New York. You'll build an understanding of the analytical needs of clients, help define how performance should be measured, and communicate the insights you discover in order to improve campaign performance in the future.

Some of the things we’d like you to do:

Get under the skin of marketing plans and client’s propositions to help formulate robust test & learn strategies and produce detailed Performance Measurement Plans prior to campaign launches
Ensure the appropriate data points are being collected from the appropriate data sources during campaign execution – to ensure Account teams and clients are measuring campaign performance in the correct way
Produce regular campaign reporting for our Account teams to share with clients, helping them understand the key drivers of performance and inform future activity
Analyze and interpret marketing program results to drive future client marketing strategies
Work closely with your peers in other practices at Essence (e.g. performance marketing, media buying and planning etc.), to ensure analytical support for campaigns is scoped properly

A bit about yourself:

Degree from a top-tier College, 3.0 GPA or equivalent
Ideally 1-3 years of data analysis experience
Proficiency with systems such as SQL, Python, R, Social Analytics tools (Crimson Hexagon), Excel, Tableau, etc.
Experience presenting data in a visually engaging and insightful manner that cuts through the noise
Experience in marketing analytics and/or digital media experience
Strong analytical skills - ability to analyze raw data, find insights, and provide actionable strategic recommendations
Have a high understanding of marketing campaigns and their objectives, experience with search analytics and/or Financial Services industry will be a plus

What you can expect from Essence

Essence’s mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. We do this by employing the world’s very best talent to solve some of the toughest challenges of today’s digital marketing landscape. It’s important that we hire people whose values reflect those of our own: genuine, results-focused, daring and insightful. As an Essence employee, we promise you a workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun and engaging. We believe these factors create a workplace where you can be yourself and do amazing work.

title: Data Visualization, Consultant at Gain Theory
description:
Data Visualization, Consultant at Gain Theory

Gain Theory is a global marketing foresight consultancy that brings together data, analytics, technology solutions and consumer-insight capabilities to help marketing and insight professionals make smarter, faster, predictive business decisions.

Gain Theory has an opening in New York City, USA for a Data Visualization Analyst in the area of marketing analytics and reporting. In this role you will create data visualizations and contribute to our growing efforts in Big Data Analytics (think Amazon Web Services, Hadoop, Vertica, Python, R, SAS, etc.). Data and Analytics is one of the fastest growing fields within Gain Theory and focuses on (1) platforms for managing data and performing analytics, (2) providing data and analytics services to clients, (3) developing new products, methods and algorithms used for data and analytics and (4) creating compelling data visualizations for actionable insights.

Gain Theory is a part of GroupM and WPP. WPP is the world leader in communication services focusing on advertising, media investment management, consumer insight, public relations and branding among others. GroupM is WPP’s consolidated media investment management operation. As such, it is the global number one media investment management group (RECMA 2010) with worldwide billing of $90.8Bn (RECMA July 2012) representing 32.7% global market share. Our clients are leaders in their respective industries and represent more than 330 of the Fortune 500, more than half of the NASDAQ 100 and more than 30 of the Fortune e-50.

The Data Visualization Analyst role is focused on leveraging our data platform and visualizing marketing data in compelling ways that uncover analytical insight. In this role you will have the opportunity to leverage industry standard data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) but you will also be expected to push the envelope with open source visualization technologies such as D3.


Role Responsibilities:
Contribute to our client facing interactive data visualization solutionsBuild data visualizations using Gain Theory’s toolkit, leveraging best-in-class tech solutionAssure that the data visualizations are accurately representing dataWork with Gain Theory client leads to understand the business needs of our end clients with regard to data insight and build visualizations that effectively deliver this insight.Work with the Gain Theory Team to understand key business objectives of the pipeline items, and how data visualization can be leveraged to make outputs as compelling as possible.Be a key contributor to the roadmap as it pertains to the selection of visualization technologies, products, and platforms.
Help instill a culture of data creativity with the Gain Theory organization
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree required.2-3 year’s work experience in data visualization initiativesAdvanced Tableau proficiency
Experience visualizing complex data ecosystemsExperience with other data visualization/reporting solutions such as QlikView, Sisense, Omniscope or MicroStrategy will be highly valued
Experience with data management/reporting solutions such as Datorama or Domo will be highly valued
Experience with open source visualization/user-interactive technologies such as JavaScript, D3 and R and how to operationalize client facing solutions based on these frameworks.Experience interacting/collaborating with a multi-functional team; Business Lead, DAS, and Data Infrastructure teams.Knowledge or minimal experience with data manipulation tools (e.g. SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc.)Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and understand how best to visualize.Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focusedProcess-driven project management a plusPrior knowledge of the advertising ecosystem, understanding of marketing/media metrics, and analytical products offered as a service is preferredFamiliarity with big-data concepts; cloud computing and open-source tools is preferred
WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

It is the policy of GroupM and its affiliates to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

title: Entry Level Economics Analyst
description:
AECOM is actively seeking a creative and highly motivated Entry Level Economics Analyst for employment at the New York, NY office to support the associates and senior management of the NY Metro Real Estate Economics Group. Our Work consists of participating in various areas of real estate and economic development consulting. We often take on multiple high profile client-facing roles in the areas of surplus real estate reuse as well as underutilized property repositioning and redevelopment.

AECOM is pleased to include you in a unique development opportunity, the Graduate Development Program (GDP). This program is designed to support your assimilation into the organization and assist with creating a foundation of knowledge for a successful career at AECOM. You will gain experience in your discipline through learning on the job and participate in development opportunities during the program, including access to AECOM's social media resources, group mentoring, and professional networking. The program also has learning activities that will be available to you, including webinars and on-line programs.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Analyze and report on census, real estate and related quantitative data sources

+ Obtain information and research from internet and non-internet based sources, as well as stakeholder interviews, to distill that information into clear concise conclusions

+ Clearly, concisely and creatively communicate a wide range of data in narrative / paragraph form, using MS Word or PowerPoint

+ Work independently with minimal supervision, as well as prioritize tasks, work within variable deadlines and handle multiple assignments that may vary in subject matter

Minimum Requirements

+ Bachelor's Degree

+ At least 1 year of professional experience in sustainability planning, urban and real estate economics, urban planning, or policy modeling/design

+ Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically, Excel, Word and PowerPoint

+ Excellent quantitative and analytical skills

+ Strong research and organizational skills

+ Excellent communication and writing skills (writing samples may be requested)

+ Keen intellectual curiosity, as well as interest in conducting research from varying sources – i.e. online, via telephone and in-person interviews as well as various industry and news publications

+ Interest and knowledge of industry trends and standards in real estate development, planning and/or economic development

+ Willingness to take initiative

+ Ability to work in a team environment across offices and regions as well as communicate information clearly

+ Willingness to travel domestically, including traveling to “out of the way” exurban and rural property site locations

Preferred Qualifications

+ Master’s degree in a related field is a plus. A journalism background in these areas in lieu of coursework is welcomed as well

+ Experience with real estate financial modeling / fiscal & economic impact / real estate market research / analysis

+ Understanding / experience with ArcView GIS, demographic and statistical software is a plus, as is familiarity with Argus

What We Offer

AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.

AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here to view the EEO Is The Law poster.
